meanings.definition: The manner in which a person behaves, especially in a particular place or situation.
meanings.sent1: His conduct at the party was polite and friendly.
meanings.sent2: Her conduct in class is always respectful towards others.
meanings.sent3: The conduct of the dog at the park was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The conduct of the traffic resembled a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The conduct of the orchestra was flawless, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: The action or manner of managing an activity or organization.
meanings.sent1: The conductor's conduct of the concert was praised by all.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's conduct of the company led to its success.
meanings.sent3: The conduct of the meeting was so efficient it finished early.
meanings.sent4: The conduct of the project resembled a carefully crafted puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The conduct of the event was well-organized and smooth.

meanings.sent1: She will conduct the experiment in the laboratory tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: He conducts the choir rehearsals with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to conduct a surprise party for their teacher.
meanings.sent4: The team will conduct a thorough investigation into the matter.
meanings.sent5: The chef will conduct a cooking class for beginners next week.
